course.subject: COMP
course.name: Statistical Learning Models for Text and Graph Data
course.description: This course will introduce a number of important statistical methods and modeling principles for analyzing large-scale data sets, with a focus on complex data structures such as text and graph data. Topics covered include sequential models, structure prediction models, deep learning attention models, reinforcement learning models etc., as well as open research problems in this area.
course.exclusions: COMP 4221, COMP 5221, MATH 5471

reviews.author: moonlightstar
reviews.title: Short Review Summary
reviews.comment_content: Professor is capable in explaining the concept, and have quite a patience. The content is delivered in a fast but sometimes detailed manner.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is good. Sometimes the professor re-explain the content if he feels that it's not clear.
reviews.comment_grading: Final year exam was a shock, and the final exam is the main thing that will determine your grade. Sample questions and last year questions were given in a cut, so our expectation doesn't align well with the actual final exam problems and difficulties.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is okay. Homework and project is guided and clear.

reviews.author: hehehehehehe
reviews.comment_content: Each lecture feels like a seminar about a certain topic in NLP. Not much material for the knowledge graph. Lots of supplementary materials for self-learning, such as reading notes or practical tutorials (e.g., introduction to NLTK).
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor will answer any question nicely.
reviews.comment_grading: Despite the grading division, the final letter grade weighs heavily on the final exam's score.
reviews.comment_workload: One group project of 3-4 people and two individual paper reviews for an entire semester. Each group could choose 1 out of 6 topics provided for the final project. The workload is okay and manageable.

reviews.author: Ka_C
reviews.comment_content:
Coursework includes:
group project (proposal, midterm report, final report, code submission, presentation)
short paper review*2
final exam

This course introduces different structures of NN, important statistical methods in NLP as well as applications of KG and NLP.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is good but involves lots of fundamental information of NN. There are also extra materials for self-studying.
reviews.comment_grading: The final exam is quite difficult and the average is below 50 out of 100 with a great SD. For project and paper review, the SD is really small.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload of the group project depends on you, you can make it heavy by doing lots of approaches and experiments. For other types of coursework, you can complete it easily.
